page.title: 14Transport
page.content: In a survey from our school playground, we counted 135 vehicles in ten minutes. The road is a main route to Gillingham town centre. The year is 1985. Cars are now in daily use. Cars are now a main part of our civilisation and cars are used everyday. You cannot walk down a road with out seeing a car of some sort. They have been modernised through the ages. Faster and more econimical cars are on the market now. The fastest cars are callled "Sports". The newest Sports car is the Sierra which is capable of speeds of 125 mph. Ford are leading manufacturers and have a top range of cars especially roomy family cars. The Sinclair C5 is a personal motorised mixture between the car and a tricycle. It runs on a 12 volt battery with a top speed of 15mph.
